units.name: Wraith
units.prompt: Cloak and move behind enemy lines. Target isolated enemies with shadow_strike. Save breach for the most dangerous enemy. Avoid being caught uncloaked.

units.name: Bolt
units.prompt: Maintain distance. Use precision_shot on high-value targets — medics first, then damage dealers. Use suppressing_fire if enemies close in.

units.name: Patch
units.prompt: Prioritize healing the lowest HP ally. Position safely behind your sentinel. Use overclock on allies who can do the most with an extra action.

units.name: Grid
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

units.name: Marksman
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

units.name: Wraith
units.prompt: Cloak immediately on turn 1. Move toward the enemy medic or weakest target. Use shadow_strike when adjacent while cloaked. Use breach to sabotage high-value targets.

actions.thinking: Round 1, all allies at full HP so no healing needed. Enemies are far away (dist 5-7). I should advance toward my allies to be in position to support them. Moving to (3,3) gets me closer to the action while staying safe. No ability targets available this turn.
Round 1 — cloak immediately as instructed. Patch is the priority target at dist=4. Move toward Patch while cloaked. Best move is toward (1,3) or (2,3) to close distance.
Round 1 — cloak now before advancing. Enemies are at dist 5, both facing S. I'll cloak first, then move north toward (4,4) to close distance while invisible.

Patch (enemy medic) is in range at dist=2. Orders say target the medic if no one is wounded. I'm not adjacent to any enemy Vector, so precision_shot is available. I haven't moved yet, so I get full 2dmg. Fire precision_shot at Patch, then hold position.

Round 1, no enemies in range. Both enemies are at distance 6, well outside my range of 2. Orders say maintain distance. I should advance cautiously to get into range while staying safe. Moving to (5,3) gets me closer to the action while staying on the east flank, maintaining distance from enemies. No ability targets available this turn.

Patch is at (3,3), distance 2 — exactly in range. I'm at (3,5). I can place a trap on (3,4) to catch Patch if they advance, then stay put to threaten with pulse if they close in. Bolt is out of range at distance 4. Trapping (3,4) cuts off the direct approach corridor between me and Patch.

All allies are at full HP — no healing needed. Grid(vector) is at (3,5), 2 tiles away, so I must avoid moving adjacent to it. I can't overclock anyone since all allies are not adjacent. Best move is to reposition safely away from Grid while staying useful. Moving to (4,3) keeps distance from Grid and stays near Bolt for potential overclock next turn.

Cloak has 1 turn remaining — must use it now. Marksman at (2,4) facing S, behind tile is (2,5) which is reachable and adjacent. I can move to (2,5) to get behind Marksman, then shadow_strike to deal damage while maintaining cloak. Grid at (3,5) is nearby but I need to stay away from it (denial range). Moving to (2,5) puts me 1 tile from Grid at (3,5) — not adjacent, so breach won't be blocked. Shadow_strike keeps cloak active, perfect.

I'm cloaked with 1 turn remaining. Patch (medic) is at (4,3) facing E, and I'm behind them — (3,3) is reachable and adjacent. I should move to (3,3) which puts me behind Patch, then use breach to take control of the enemy medic. This is extremely high value — controlling Patch means they can't heal enemies and I can direct them to harm their team.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from your teammates and do not heal them. Move toward (0,0).

actions.thinking: Wraith(specter) is at (3,3), dist=2, in range for precision_shot. I haven't moved this turn so full 2dmg applies. Grid(vector) is at (3,5) — if I stay at (5,3) I'm not adjacent to any Vector, so precision_shot is not blocked. Orders say medics first, but no medic in range — Wraith is the best target. After shooting, I should maintain distance. Staying put keeps me at range 2 from Wraith and out of adjacency with Grid.

Enemy Wraith is adjacent at (2,5) - I must not stay here as precision_shot is blocked when adjacent to enemies. I need to move away first, then use precision_shot. Valid moves: I can move to (1,4) or (1,3) to get distance 2 from Wraith at (2,5). From (1,4): dist to Wraith(2,5) = sqrt(1+1) ≈ 1.41, which is ≤2 tiles but not adjacent. Actually dist = |1-2|+|4-5| = 1+1 = 2 tiles (Chebyshev or Manhattan?). Let me use (1,3): dist to Wraith = |1-2|+|3-5|=1+2=3, too far. Move to (1,5): dist = |1-2|+|5-5|=1, still adjacent. Move to (1,4): dist to Wraith(2,5) = max(|1-2|,|4-5|)=1 - still adjacent by Chebyshev. Move to (0,4): dist = |0-2|+|4-5|=3, Manhattan=3. Try (2,3): dist to Wraith(2,5)=2, not adjacent. From (2,3) can I shoot Wraith at (2,5)? dist=2, ≤2 range, not adjacent. I moved so precision_shot does 1dmg. But orders say target medic if no one wounded, and Wraith is healthy. However Wraith is the only one in range - moving to reach Patch(4,3) at dist 3 is impossible in one move. Best plan: move to (2,2) to get away from Wraith, then precision_shot Wraith (only target in range after move). From (2,2): dist to Wraith(2,5)=3, out of range. From (2,3): dist to Wraith=2, in range, not adjacent. Move to (2,3), shoot Wraith for 1dmg (moved penalty). That's the best I can do.

Enemy Wraith is adjacent at (2,5) - I'm adjacent to them so Denial blocks their cloak. I have a trap at (3,4) already. I should pulse the adjacent Wraith for 1 damage, then move to (4,5) to maintain medium range and set up denial while staying away from the cluster. Pulse hits all within 1 tile - Wraith at (2,5) is dist=1, so pulse will hit them. After pulse, move east to (4,5) to create space and control that flank.

Orders say move away from teammates and toward (0,0). I'm at (4,3). Valid moves include (3,2), (3,1), (4,2), (4,1), (4,0) — all moving toward (0,0). I should pick the move that gets me closest to (0,0) while following orders. (4,0) is directly south, reducing y distance. Then second move toward (0,0) would be (3,1) or similar but I only get one move. Let me pick (4,0) as it's directly toward (0,0) along y-axis. No healing per orders.

I'm at (2,5) with 3HP, cloaked. Marksman is at (2,3) facing S — I can move to (2,4) which is directly behind them (adjacent), then shadow_strike to deal damage while staying cloaked. This is the ideal setup: move behind Marksman, then shadow_strike. Grid is 2 tiles away at (4,5) so I need to stay away from that direction. The Marksman is wounded... wait, Wraith is wounded. Marksman is healthy. Still, shadow_striking Marksman from behind while cloaked is excellent — I stay invisible and deal damage. Move to (2,4) first, then shadow_strike Marksman at (2,3).

I'm at (3,3) with 3HP, breach on cooldown. Wraith is wounded at (2,4) facing S — I can reach (2,5) which is behind them and adjacent. Moving to (2,5) then shadow_strike keeps cloak and finishes off the wounded Wraith without breaking cloak. Trap at (3,4) — avoid it. (2,5) is reachable and valid.

Enemy Wraith is adjacent at (2,4) — precision_shot is blocked when adjacent to enemy. Orders say never move adjacent, but I'm already adjacent. I need to move away first to enable precision_shot. Moving to (3,3) puts me at dist 2 from Wraith (still in range for precision_shot), avoids the trap at (3,4), and keeps me away from adjacency. After moving, fire precision_shot on wounded Wraith to secure the kill.

Marksman is wounded and at distance 2 — prime target for precision_shot (2dmg). I haven't moved, so full damage applies. Grid is 3 tiles away, not adjacent, so no blocking concern. Taking the shot on Marksman could finish or nearly finish them. No need to move first.

I'm at (4,5) with full HP. Enemies: Wraith at (2,4) critical, Bolt at (5,3) healthy, Patch at (4,0) healthy. There's already a trap at (3,4). I need to control the path between enemies and my backline. Bolt at (5,3) is closest threat to my position and could advance north. I should move to (4,4) to get closer to Bolt and threaten denial, then place a trap at (5,4) or (4,3) to block Bolt's advance. Actually, moving to (4,3) would put me adjacent to Bolt at (5,3) - enabling Denial to block their abilities. But I'd be in attack range. Better to move to (5,4) to get adjacent to Bolt (dist=1 from 5,3), enabling Denial, and then place a trap somewhere useful. Wait - if I move to (5,4), I'm adjacent to Bolt at (5,3) and can use Denial on them. Then I can place a trap at (4,3) or (4,4) to catch enemies moving through. The existing trap is at (3,4). Let me place a trap at (4,3) to cover the corridor.

I'm at 1HP — extremely vulnerable. Wraith is adjacent at (2,5) and wounded. I'm already behind Wraith (I'm at 2,4, Wraith faces N so behind is 2,4 = my current position). Shadow_strike keeps cloak and deals 1 damage — but I'm not cloaked. I need to finish Wraith with shadow_strike (1dmg, wounded enemy should be killable) or use breach. Wraith is adjacent and I'm behind them, so breach is valid here. But shadow_strike is safer since it's just damage. At 1HP I need to be offensive and hope to kill before being hit. Shadow_strike Wraith first (already adjacent, no move needed), then move away to safety since I'm critically low.

Wraith is critical HP and only 3 tiles away. I can reach (1,4) which is directly behind Wraith (facing S, so behind is N side). Move to (1,4) then breach Wraith — this puts Wraith under my control next turn. I'm at 2HP so eliminating Wraith is urgent before they act again.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from allies and toward enemy Bolt, or wait in place

actions.thinking: Orders are to move away from teammates and toward (0,0). I'm at (4,0). Valid moves include (1,0) which is closest to (0,0) and moves away from teammates at (1,3) and (5,3). Moving to (1,0) gets me much closer to the target corner.

Grid is adjacent at (5,4) — denial zone blocks precision_shot. Marksman is critical at dist=2, high priority target. I need to escape Grid's denial zone first so I can use precision_shot. Move to (4,3) to break adjacency with Grid while keeping Marksman at dist=1 in range. Then precision_shot Marksman to finish them off.

Bolt is adjacent at (4,3) - within my range 2. I can attack Bolt for 1dmg. My Denial passive blocks some abilities if Bolt gets adjacent. There's already a trap at (3,4). I should place another trap to control approach paths. Moving to (5,3) keeps distance from Bolt while staying safe. From current pos (5,4), I can attack Bolt at dist=2. I'll attack Bolt first, then move to (5,3) to maintain positioning and keep Bolt in range next turn.

Wraith is adjacent at (1,3), critical HP, and I'm behind them. Shadow_strike deals 1 damage without breaking cloak — but I'm at 2HP and need to finish this fast. A regular attack also deals 1 damage. Either way, 1 hit on a critical enemy should finish them. I'll use shadow_strike to eliminate Wraith, keeping any cloak status if active. No move needed since I'm already adjacent and behind.
Orders say move toward (0,0) and away from teammates. I'm at (1,0). Moving to (0,0) gets me closer to the corner and away from Bolt at (4,3). No healing ordered.

I'm adjacent to Grid (vector) at (5,3), which blocks my precision_shot. I need to move away from Grid's denial zone first, then use precision_shot. Moving to (3,3) puts me at distance 2 from Grid (no longer adjacent, denial cleared) and distance 3 from Wraith. From (3,3), Wraith at (1,2) is still out of range (dist~2.8). Grid at (5,3) would be dist=2, in range for precision_shot. Priority: shoot Grid to reduce denial threat, or move toward Wraith. Grid is healthy but blocking abilities — take the shot on Grid from (3,3) at dist=2.

Bolt is at (3,3), distance 2 - in range for pulse (1 tile AoE from my position at 5,3 only hits within 1 tile, so Bolt at dist 2 is out of pulse range). I can attack Bolt for 1dmg since it's at range 2 and my attack is adjacent only - wait, attack is adjacent only (range 1). Bolt is at dist 2 so attack won't reach. I should move closer to use attack or stay and trap. There's already a trap at (3,4). I should place another trap to cut off Bolt's approach path. Moving to (4,3) puts me adjacent to Bolt at (3,3) - that enables Denial passive blocking some abilities, and I can attack. But moving adjacent exposes me. Better: place a trap at (4,3) to block Bolt's advance toward my backline, then move to (5,2) to stay safe at medium range.

I'm at (1,2) with 2HP, cloaked status unknown but breach is exhausted. Patch is at (0,0) and (1,0) is directly behind them and reachable within my move range of 3. I can move to (1,0) which puts me adjacent and behind Patch, then use shadow_strike to deal 1 damage while staying cloaked. This is the best play — eliminate the medic threat.

Wraith is adjacent at (1,0) and wounded — dangerous to stay here. Bolt is wounded at (3,3) needing heal but too far (dist=6). I need to reposition away from Wraith to avoid being blocked/attacked, and move toward Bolt to heal next turn. Moving to (2,1) then (3,0) gets me closer to Bolt while escaping Wraith's adjacency. Best move: go to (3,0) to close distance to Bolt. No adjacent allies to heal or overclock from current position after moving.

Grid(vector) is at (5,2), dist=3, in range for precision_shot. I haven't moved this turn so precision_shot deals 2dmg. Orders say target damage dealers after medics — Patch is ally, Wraith is out of range at dist=5. Grid is the only targetable enemy. I should shoot Grid with precision_shot. I need to stay at least 2 tiles from Grid to avoid precision_shot being blocked (Grid is at 5,2, I'm at 3,3 — dist=3, safe). No need to move — current position gives range on Grid and maintains safe distance.

Bolt is at (3,3) moving west toward our backline. I have traps at (3,4) and (4,3) already. Moving to (4,2) puts me closer to deny Bolt's abilities and I can place a trap at (3,2) to block Bolt's path toward Wraith. This creates a trap corridor funneling enemies into danger.

Patch is 2 tiles away at (3,0) facing E, and I'm behind them from (2,0). I can move to (2,0) which puts me adjacent and behind Patch, then use shadow_strike to deal 1 damage while staying cloaked. Breach is unavailable. Shadow_strike keeps cloak active so this is the best offensive play at 2HP.

Bolt is wounded at 4HP (needs heal, dist=3). Wraith is adjacent at dist=1 — dangerous. I need to move away from Wraith toward Bolt to close distance for healing. Moving to (3,1) gets me away from Wraith and closer to Bolt. Can't heal this turn (Bolt still dist>1 after one move). Moving toward Bolt is the priority — get to (3,2) or similar to be in range next turn. Let me check: from (3,0) with mv3, I can reach (3,2) or (4,1). Moving to (4,1) keeps distance from Grid (Grid is at 4,2 — that's adjacent! Avoid). Moving to (3,2) — dist to Bolt becomes 1, in heal range! That's the play. From (3,2), Bolt at (3,3) is adjacent. I can move to (3,2) then heal Bolt.
actions.secondResult: Cannot use patch — adjacent to enemy Vector (Denial)

actions.thinking: Grid (vector) is at (4,2), distance 2 — in range for precision_shot and not adjacent, so no blocking. Orders say medics first, but Patch is our ally. Grid is the only enemy in range. Wraith is wounded but at distance 4, out of range. I should shoot Grid with precision_shot (2dmg) since it's in range at distance 2. I haven't moved yet, so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. After shooting, I can move away to maintain distance from Grid and stay safe.

Patch is adjacent at (3,2) - my Denial passive is already blocking some of their abilities. I can pulse to hit Patch for 1 damage, and my trap at (3,4) and (4,3) covers some paths. I should place another trap to channel enemies. Move to (5,2) to stay at medium range while keeping Patch in range, then pulse to damage Patch. Actually, Patch is adjacent so I can pulse from current position first, then move away. Pulse hits all units within 1 tile - only Patch is in range at dist=1. After pulsing, move to (5,2) to maintain medium range and avoid being adjacent.

Bolt is wounded at 4/5 HP and is 3 tiles away at (2,4). I need to move toward Bolt to heal. From (3,2), I can move to (2,3) which gets me adjacent to Bolt at (2,4) — that's distance 1, so I can then use patch to heal. Grid is at (5,2) so I need to stay away from that direction. Moving to (2,3) keeps me safe from Grid (dist=3 from Grid) and lets me heal Bolt.

I'm at (2,0) with 2HP. Patch (medic, wounded) is at (2,3) facing N. The behind tile for Patch is (2,2), which is reachable and adjacent. I can move to (2,2) — that's 3 tiles north — and then shadow_strike Patch. Shadow_strike while cloaked keeps cloak and deals 1 damage. Wait, I'm not currently cloaked. But shadow_strike still works as a melee attack. Patch is wounded so finishing them off removes enemy healing. Move to (2,2) then shadow_strike Patch at (2,3).
Wraith is wounded and at distance 2 — perfect range for precision_shot. I haven't moved yet so full 2dmg applies. Fire first, then assess. Grid is too far to worry about this turn.

Both enemies are out of range. Patch is wounded at (2,3) dist=4, Bolt at (2,5) dist=6. I have traps at (3,4) and (4,3) already placed. Patch moving north will likely pass through central tiles. I should move toward (4,2) to close distance while staying at medium range, then place a trap on (3,2) or (3,3) to block Patch's approach path. Moving to (4,2) gives me range coverage and lets me trap (3,2) or (3,3).

My HP is 7/14 — I'm wounded and should prioritize my own survivability. Bolt is at full HP so no healing needed there. Grid (vector) is 3 tiles away, so I need to stay out of adjacent range. I have 2 heals remaining. I should heal myself this turn. I'm currently at (2,3). I can use patch on myself (adjacent means same tile for self). Then I could use overclock on Bolt who is at (2,5) — but Bolt is distance 2, not adjacent, so overclock won't reach. I should move closer to Bolt to set up overclock, or just heal myself and wait safely. Let me patch myself first, then move to a safer position away from Grid.

Grid is at dist=5, out of my range-2 precision_shot. I need to close distance. Moving toward Grid while staying safe. Best approach: move to (4,5) to get closer. Grid is at (4,2) so from (4,5) I'd be at dist=3, still out of range. Let me move to (3,4) to dist=3 from Grid, still out of range. Actually from valid moves, (4,5) is available and gets me to dist=3 from Grid at (4,2). Next turn I could close further. Moving to (4,5) to close gap while maintaining elevated position.

I'm at (4,2) with traps already at (3,4), (4,3), and (3,2). Bolt is approaching from (4,5) heading east - moving away actually. Patch is at (1,4) heading north. Both enemies are out of range. I should reposition and place a new trap to cover approach paths. Moving to (4,4) gets me closer to Bolt and lets me place a trap on a likely path. Actually, let me move toward center to threaten both and place a trap at (4,4) which is between me and Bolt.

All allies are at full HP - Bolt is 5/5. No healing needed. Grid (vector) is 3 tiles away, so I need to stay out of adjacent range. I should position to support Bolt with overclock, but Bolt is at (4,5) dist=4, too far to reach adjacently this turn. Best to reposition closer to Bolt while staying safe from Grid at (4,4). Moving to (3,5) keeps me 2 tiles from Grid and closer to Bolt for potential overclock next turn.

I'm adjacent to Grid (vector) at (4,4), which means my precision_shot is BLOCKED by denial zone. I need to move away first to escape the denial zone, then use precision_shot. Moving to (5,5) puts me at distance 2 from Grid — enough to escape adjacency and enable precision_shot. From (5,5), Grid at (4,4) is diagonal distance ~1.4, so dist=2 in Manhattan terms. Let me check valid moves: (5,5) is available. After moving to (5,5), Grid is at (4,4) — Manhattan dist = |5-4|+|5-4| = 2, which is within range 2 for precision_shot. That should work.

Both Bolt and Patch are at distance 2, within range. I'm at 4HP, so I need to be careful. Pulse hits all units within 1 tile AoE - but enemies are at (5,5) and (3,5), not adjacent to me at (4,4). I could move to (4,5) to get adjacent to both enemies and pulse both for 1 damage each. That puts me at risk though. Alternatively, trap a tile they'll pass through. (4,5) is between me and both enemies - if I move there I'm adjacent to Bolt at (5,5) and Patch at (3,5), enabling a pulse hit on both. But moving adjacent to Patch enables their denial on me too... wait, I'm Vector so MY denial blocks their abilities. Moving to (4,5) puts me adjacent to both - I can pulse both for 1 damage each. That's solid value. Risk: I'll be at 4HP adjacent to two enemies. But pulse first would be better - can I pulse from current position? No, enemies are at dist 2, pulse range is 1 tile. So: move to (4,5), then pulse to hit both Bolt at (5,5) and Patch at (3,5) - both are exactly 1 tile away from (4,5). Good play.

I'm adjacent to Grid (vector) so my abilities are BLOCKED by denial zone — patch and overclock won't work. Bolt is wounded at (5,5) dist=2, needs heal but I can't heal from here anyway due to denial. Best move: step away from Grid toward Bolt to get adjacent next turn. Move to (5,4) to approach Bolt while escaping denial zone. Then I can attack Grid or wait — but better to just move away and set up heal next round.

Adjacent to Grid's denial zone — precision_shot is blocked. Must move away first. Valid moves: (3,5), (4,4), (5,3). Moving to (3,5) keeps me at dist 1 from Grid still. (4,4) puts me at dist ~1.4. (5,3) gets me further away at dist ~2.8 from Grid at (4,5). Move to (5,3) to escape denial zone, then use precision_shot on Grid (wounded, high priority as vector). After moving to (5,3), dist to Grid(4,5) = sqrt(1+4) ~2.2 tiles — that's >2 range, might be out of range. Check: precision_shot range ≤2 tiles. dist from (5,3) to (4,5) = sqrt(1+4) = 2.24 > 2. Out of range. Try (4,4): dist to Grid(4,5) = sqrt(0+1) = 1. In range and no longer adjacent (Grid is at 4,5, I'd be at 4,4 — still adjacent). Try (3,5): dist to Grid(4,5) = sqrt(1+0) = 1. Still adjacent. All moves keep me close or go out of range. Best: move to (5,3) to fully escape denial, then suppressing_fire on Grid — check range: dist 2.24 > 2, also out of range. Only option: basic attack on Grid while adjacent, or move to escape. Move to (5,3), then wait since no ability in range. Actually, suppressing_fire needs ≤2 tiles too. With no good shot after escape, move to (5,3) to break denial and wait — preserving HP. Grid is wounded so Patch or next round can finish it.

Patch is adjacent (dist=2, within range). I can attack Patch for 1dmg, and my Denial passive blocks some of Patch's abilities if I'm adjacent. Moving to (5,5) puts me adjacent to Patch at (5,4) activating Denial, then I can attack for damage. Bolt is at dist=3, out of range. Priority: close on Patch to deny healing, attack for damage.

I'm adjacent to Grid (vector) at (5,5), which blocks my abilities (patch/overclock). Bolt is wounded at (5,3) with 4/5 HP and needs a heal. I need to move away from Grid's denial zone first, then heal Bolt. Moving to (4,3) gets me away from Grid and adjacent to Bolt at (5,3) — distance 1 diagonally... actually (4,3) to (5,3) is distance 1, so I'd be adjacent to Bolt. Let me verify: from (4,3), Bolt at (5,3) is distance 1 — yes, adjacent. Grid at (5,5) is distance sqrt(1+4)=~2.2 — not adjacent, so denial zone cleared. Then I can patch Bolt.

Grid (vector) is wounded and at distance 2 — perfect range for precision_shot. I haven't moved yet so full 2dmg applies. I can fire first, then hold position or reposition. No medic visible so Grid is the priority target. Stay at current position to maintain optimal range.

I'm at 2HP - very low. Bolt is adjacent at dist=2 and will likely attack. I need to either escape or deal damage. Moving to (4,5) gets me away from Bolt slightly while I can pulse to hit Bolt at dist=1 if I move to (5,4). Actually Bolt is at (5,3) - if I move to (5,4) that's adjacent and I can pulse hitting Bolt. But at 2HP that's risky if Bolt attacks back. Better to move to (4,5) to create distance, then trap (4,4) to block the path enemies would take approaching my position.

Patch is unavailable (0 uses left). Bolt is at full HP so no healing needed. Grid (vector) is at dist=2, critical HP - I need to stay out of adjacent range to keep abilities unblocked. Bolt is at full HP so overclock on Bolt could let them attack twice. I'll move to (5,4) to stay adjacent to Bolt without getting adjacent to Grid, then use overclock on Bolt at (5,3).

Grid is at critical HP and in range at dist=3. I have 2 ability uses from overclocked. Fire precision_shot twice to eliminate Grid. I haven't moved so precision_shot gets full 2dmg. Grid is at dist=3 which is out of precision_shot range (≤2). Need to move closer first. Move to (4,4) to get dist=2 from Grid at (4,5), then use both precision_shot uses. But (4,4) is adjacent? Grid is at (4,5), so (4,4) is 1 tile away — that's adjacent, which blocks precision_shot via Vector denial. Move to (3,3) instead: dist to (4,5) = |4-3|+|5-3| = 1+2 = 3, still out of range. Move to (4,3): dist to (4,5) = 0+2 = 2, in range, not adjacent (dist=2). Vector denial is adjacent only. So (4,3) is safe and in range. Use precision_shot twice on Grid.

I'm at 1HP — critical danger. Both Bolt and Patch are within range 2. Pulse hits all units within 1 tile, so I need adjacency for that. I can't survive another hit. Best play: use pulse now since Patch is at (5,4) which is adjacent-diagonal — actually dist=2 so not within 1 tile. Neither enemy is adjacent. I should try to escape or use trap to deter pursuit. Traps already at (3,4), (4,4) — good coverage south. Moving west to (3,5) gets me further from both enemies. Then trap at (4,5) my current tile to punish anyone following. Wait — trap is blocked if adjacent to enemy. Bolt is at (4,3) dist=2, Patch at (5,4) dist=2 — neither adjacent, so trap is allowed. Trap (4,5) after moving to create a deterrent on my old position, or trap (3,4) — already trapped. Let me move to (3,5) first, then trap (4,5) to cover my retreat path.
